text: (Joff) The announcement by Tony Evers that he would press for the decriminalization of marijuana in Wisconsin was one of the biggest sprayings in his young term. It attracted media coverage from all over the country and triggered a war of news bulletins on the front line. On February 18, 2019, Evers said that his first budget would include proposals to legitimize medical marijuana; allow for the possession of small quantities of marijuana for personal use; and expand the capacity to cancel some drug convictions. News releases announced the transmission of medical benefits from marijuana, then focused on making the cause of social justice change. "The reform of marijuana laws in Wisconsin to conform to the people's medical support for marijuana is an important part of the Governor's plan," said the release. "But this also addresses the social and ethnic justice aspect of marijuana abuse. Wisconsin has the highest prison rate in the country for black men, and drug-related crimes account for as much as 75-85 per cent of all prisoners in our prisons."
